title: Middlewood Way Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: Gerald England / Middlewood Way, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Nice view of the tree lined, surfaced path

images.title: Stephen McKay / Welcome to the Middlewood Way, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Welcome sign at the start of the route

images.title: Alan Murray-Rust / Middlewood Way, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Looking south from Prince Road bridge. The Way is split into all-user (right) and pedestrian-only (left) paths. When created, trees were planted in the median strip but these were found to create a very dark atmosphere, as well as significantly adding to maintenance costs of the pathways, so they have recently been removed.

images.title: Mike Kirby / Middlewood Way, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: This section, viewed from Lyme Road bridge, used to be Higher Poynton rail station. It's now a beautifully landscaped picnic area, ideal for stopping at for a sandwich on the route.

images.title: John Darch / Bridge over Middlewood Way, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Bridge over the trail, carrying the Adlington to Pott Shrigley Road.

images.title: Peter Turner / Middlewood Way bridge over Middlewood Station, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Middlewood Way bridge over Middlewood Station

images.title: Roger  Kidd / The Middlewood Way at Higher Poynton, Cheshire, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The path at Higher Poynton on a sunny summer day

images.title: Chris Wimbush / Middlewood Way near Lyme Road, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Lyme Road

description: Follow the Middlewood Way - a lovely off road cycle and walking path running from Macclesfield to Marple and passing by the Macclesfield Canal. The route runs along the track of the old Macclesfield, Bollington and Marple railway which closed in 1970. It covers a distance of about 11 miles on a flat resurfaced path suitable for most types of bike. As such its a nice easy ride suitable for most abilities and ideal for families looking for a safe ride in the area.
